thread.section_title: What the hell is that massive blob that’s washed up in the Philippines? – Metro
thread.title: What the hell is that massive blob that’s washed up in the Philippines?
thread.title_full: What the hell is that massive blob that’s washed up in the Philippines?

author: Richard Hartley-Parkinson
title: What the hell is that massive blob that’s washed up in the Philippines?
text:
(Picture: Marjorie Cabatingan Aboy) Okay, internet detectives, here’s one for you: What the hell is this?
A massive white blob has emerged days after an earthquake off the coast of the Philippines.
The huge hairy beast appeared in Cagdainao, Dinagat Islands and has attracted quite a lot of attention from the locals.
There are theories as to what it is, but nothing soldid as yet.
(Picture: Marjorie Cabatingan Aboy) (Picture: Marjorie Cabatingan Aboy) The earthquake struck on Sunday and since then many carcasses have been washed up.
Some believe that it may be a whale, others have suggested a polar bear. Or a whale/polar bear hybrid. Or a big Shih tzu.
Body piercer cuts off finger because 'she wanted to' We think it looks a bit like an English sheepdog.
When a mass of organic matter washes up on the shore like this it is referred to as a ‘globster’.
By the way, the mystery has actually been solved. It’s the body of a whale and it’s in advanced decomposition. It’s believed to have died two weeks ago after being hit by a ship.
(Picture: Marjorie Cabatingan Aboy) (Picture: Marjorie Cabatingan Aboy)
